Fields.DialogueText: Well, Captain? Are you gonna call, or fold?
I shouldn't have agreed to play poker with you.
Oh, come now. You look like you're having fun.
Well, I *was* having fun...
... Until you put down a *fifth* ace.
Did I? How careless of me.

Fields.MenuText: I can't play if you're going to cheat.
Do you really think I'm that stupid?
It's a good thing we're not playing for money.

Fields.DialogueText: If we were, you'd have lost your shirt.
Of course not, Captain! I must have shuffled two decks together. An honest mistake.
Well, I never said *you* couldn't cheat... that's just part of the game.
*ALARM*
Rats. Can we call this a draw, Captain?
Whatever helps you sleep at night.
@BATTLE
Say, Captain..
Hm? What's on your mind?
Why did we set course for Norway?
Bit far from our normal patrol route, isn't it?
Oh, did I forget to tell you? We've got a special mission. Civilian aid.
*That's* a new one.

Fields.MenuText: We go where Command sends us.
Don't worry, it's all routine.
Command figured you might say that. They're willing to sweeten the deal with some luxury supplies.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Captain! I didn't mean to imply anything else.
Ugh, that's what I was afraid of.
Bribery, Captain? Do you really think so little of me?
I think you'll be surprised.
Didn't think you did.
*ALARM*
Ugh, why did they have to come now? I'm dying of curiosity.
Curiosity killed the cat.
Good thing I'm a Belle, then.
@BATTLE
If the double-heavy blankets are right...
Oh, they're right. But I reserve the right to object on grounds of principle-- stop grinning, Captain!
So, this "civilian aid" mission...
Mm? Right, I forgot to fill you in.
I'm just confused about the mission parameters, Captain.
Far as I know, there's no major refugee movements up there.
Not yet.
Knock on wood.
So what are we doing? Escort? Picking up a VIP?
Something like that.
We're stopping in at Narvik. Picking up a load of valuables. Precious metals, artwork, some historical artefacts.
Valuables? And the Fleet signed *off* on this?
Why wouldn't they?

Fields.MenuText: Think about it for a second...
They have their reasons...
Hm, I'm surprised you're turning down a cargo of treasure.

Fields.DialogueText: I am thinking about it, and I don't see why--
And you got mad at *me* for smuggling...
I would *not!* But--
*ALARM*
Ah. At least *this* makes sense.
Don't get too comfortable. A fight is a fight.
@BATTLE
Captain, you still haven't explained *why* we're on this mission.
Is the Fleet *trying* to spoil me?

Fields.MenuText: Not everything is about you, Glorious.
I wish. You deserve a break.
This is a transport mission, not a treasure hunt.

Fields.DialogueText: You have no sense of adventure, Captain.
What? You mean I'm *nothing* more than a cog in a giant war machine? Well, I *never,* Captain.
Thank you, Captain. They should make you an admiral.
I appreciate the jokes, but this is serious, Glorious.
We have to take this mission, and we can't afford to mess it up.
Why take it at all, Captain? It doesn't seem like a strategic priority.
Think about it for a second, Glorious.
Nobody wants their valuables anywhere near the coast. It's a recipe for disaster.
So folks are moving whatever they can inland. And if they're close to the land war...
They might decide it's a good idea to move it to a country that's a little more... neutral.
I see. Let me guess where this is going.
If we let people take care of this themselves, there will be a whole kit and caboodle of civilian ships going across the Atlantic...
Perfect sitting ducks for Morgana scavengers. Best case scenario, we rescue them.
Worst case scenario, Corruption gets a tennis bracelet and a new string of pearls.
Exactly. By taking some of these valuables as cargo, we take some of the pressure off civilian shipping. We'd already be going to America anyway.
Hm. I think I get it now, thank you.
You really need to understand *why* you're doing things, don't you?
Yes, Captain. Don't you?
*ALARM*
Well, at least Morganas are easy to understand.
We shoot them, they shoot us, one of us walks away.
I admire your optimism.
@BATTLE
Knock on wood, but I'd say things are going pretty well.
Knock on wood. But we've made it to Narvik in one piece. That's not nothing.
It's not. And we've got some new recruits, too.
Captain! We've started loading the gold!
The *what now.*
... Oh, good grief.
You didn't tell me the valuables were gold!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't think I'd need to tell you!
Let's not argue in front of the crew.
It shouldn't matter!

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it *does* matter! You know I need gold for-- for my *plan*, Captain.
I'm not *arguing* with you! I'm just-- why didn't you *tell* me?
Well-- You *should* have! Now I'm going to have to - to-- Why didn't you *tell* me, Captain?
I didn't tell you because I didn't think it would *matter.* We're professionals, and you're going to stay professional about this.
Of course, Captain.
*ALARM*
Couldn't have happened at a *better* time.
They're so *punctual*.
Stations, everyone! We'll show them what our new crew can do.
Yes! We can fight them off.
Let's hope you're right...
Yes, Captain. And the portraits are all secured.
@BATTLE
Glorious, can we talk?
Talk? What do we need to talk about?
You know full well.
If it's the gold, what's there to talk about?
Your eye's twitching every time I say it.
It is *not*.
Gold. Gold gold gold. Gold gold gold gold gold.
All right, all right!
You've made your point. But I don't see what--
Listen. I know this cargo is going to be a problem for you, no matter what.
But I was thinking... there's got to be other things you can do to bring Courageous back. Aren't there?
... I've got to talk the Admiralty into this, and they won't even consider it without the cash.

Fields.MenuText: Who says you need the Admiralty?
There have got to be other ways to resurrect a Belle.
Death is a natural part of life. Sometimes you just have to move on.

Fields.DialogueText: If there's a way to bring her back, I *can't* just "move on."
Like what, Captain? I can't just build my own ship.
The Admiralty.
You know... There's a French Belle, Provence... you might want to talk to her.
Hm? What does she have to do with the price of milk?
Rumour has it that she might have built a Belle.
All by herself? Well, I never.
Maybe you should write her. See what she has to say.
Oh, Captain, I'm terrible at replying to letters. I can't even write Furious back, and she's my sister.
Would you do it to bring Courageous back?
Fair enough.
*ALARM*
See? This is why I can never reply to letters.
Well, just do your best.
@BATTLE
We made it! Our second port of call.
Indeed. And we're loading up on schedule, too.
You know, it's strange to see all this stuff getting loaded aboard?
Why? Because of the g--
*Don't* remind me, Captain.
If it's not that, then what...?
When we took on cargo in Norway, the locals were afraid of Morganas and the Axis. And now, here in Rostock...
They're afraid of Morganas and the *Allies.*
That's true.
What I really don't understand is....
Why are people treating these *paintings* like they're gold?

Fields.MenuText: You have no eye for art.
Art is more important than gold.
Don't know. People have strange tastes.

Fields.DialogueText: You can say that again, Captain. Eesh.
Not by a long shot, Captain.
Damn straight I don't.
Art won't bring Courageous back. Why should I care about it?
Well...
Captain! We've sighted Morganas to the south! What should we do?
Get to your stations! And sound the damn alarm.
And there's the other reason I'm not a fan of art.
... The Morganas?
Mm. No time to appreciate it.
@BATTLE
Captain! Look what I found.
What is that? Looks like some kind of costume...
It's a diving suit! And - oof - here's the helmet!
Why on earth did we have one of these aboard?
I, uh... I have no idea.
Sure. Suuuuure.
You don't have to give me *that* look!
What look?
Eugh. There was something I wanted to *ask* you, Captain--
Fire away.
When we lay anchor across the pond...
Can I give this thing a spin?

Fields.MenuText: Dare I ask why?
Absolutely *not.*
We'll have to do a safety check first...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, you're a wet blanket, Captain.
Treasure hunting, Captain! There's all sorts of sunken ships from the Golden Age of pirates--
If that suit breaks down, you'll be the one who's wet.
Can't a girl have *any* fun?
She can. Aboard the ship. Where I can keep an eye on things.
Should have known.
Please, Captain? I'll make it worth your while.
Are you trying to bribe me?
What? No, I was just--
*ALARM*
Can we at least agree that you won't try fighting Morganas in that thing?
I'm not *that* careless! - Am I?
No comment.
@BATTLE
Glorious? Where the hell are you?
Eep!
I've been looking all over for you. What are you doing down here?
Nothing, Captain! Absolutely nothing.
So it's just a coincidence you're down in the hold?
Yes, Captain.
Where they're keeping all the gold.
*Yes,* Captain.
Don't you *trust* me? I'm your *Belle.*

Fields.MenuText: I want to trust you.
You've just put down five aces.
I can't trust you around gold.

Fields.DialogueText: Then please *try!*
You'll hold that against me until the end of time, won't you?
I'm-- this isn't-- what?!
*ALARM*
Well, I *was* going to tell you you had mail, but--
But now's not the time? Got it.
@BATTLE
Another poker game, hm?
How'd you guess?
The cards were a dead giveaway.
Well, I'm trying to get to know our new crewmates better. Isn't that right, boys?
Yep! And Miss Glorious knows how to have a good time!
I'll say. Let's keep playing, I'm on a roll!
Lucky you. You've made enough off of us to pay off all my debts.
Maybe you should pray to Lady Luck, then. Or get on our Fräulein's good side.
You're a card, Markus. Say, Captain, do you want to cut in?

Fields.MenuText: I'd prefer not to.
Depends. Are you going to cheat again?
Who's the empty chair you're dealing to?

Fields.DialogueText: Cheat? Oh, come now, Captain, it was an honest mistake.
Suit yourself. These two are a laugh and a half.
Sanger from navigation. Keeps finding excuses to leave. I swear I'll keelhaul him if he doesn't come back.
*ALARM*
Ugh, just my luck...
We'll have to pick this up later, gentlemen.
Don't forget my winnings.
I won't. *And* I won't forget the cards you hid under your seat.
(Does *everyone* aboard cheat?)
@BATTLE
I'm sure his luck has nothing to do with it.
Not in the way you think. He's doubled up since he scarpered.
Oh, look, it's your friend.
Hm?
That German weather ship. The one we ran into before the blockade.
We're not exactly friends, but... Hail her?
Hm? You want to talk to her?
I want to see if she has a Belle aboard.

Fields.MenuText: Does it matter? She's a weather ship.
... Is this about your sister?
Can't you get a visual?

Fields.DialogueText: I could try, but I want to hear what she has to say.
Humour me, Captain.
You're so sharp you'll cut yourself, Captain.
Glorious, this is Hessen, can you read me? Over.
Reading you loud and clear, Hessen.
I - I wanted to apologize. For the other day. I--
I was just following orders, I didn't want to lie to you but they said no one could know, I'm sorry, I'm so sorry--
Look, kid. You don't have to apologize.
I- I don't? I'm sorry.
(Eesh, Captain. This one's strung like a cheap guitar.)
(I'm sure she's doing her best.)
You don't have to apologize for anything. All's fair in love and war.
But do me a favour, kid?
Of course!
Get better at lying.
I - I don't understand.
I'm *embarrassed* for you, y'know what I mean? If you're gonna tell a lie, tell it with your whole chest.
I- I'm sorry.
Don't apologize! Here. Practice on me now.
What?
Tell me a lie.
Uhhhhhhh...
I - I'm *not* sorry!
Attagirl. Keep that up, and you'll make us all proud.
*ALARM*
Get out of here, kid. We'll handle this.
U-Understood! I'm not scared! We'll be fine!
You can stop lying now! Go!
@BATTLE
Hmm... it's a quiet night. Too quiet.
I should probably figure out what Glorious is up to, but to be honest...
It's nice to have some quiet time. Everyone needs a dull moment.
I have a nice glass of wine and a good book...
*sip*
... This tastes... funny.
My head feels... strange...
God... dammit. Someone... drugged...
Gotta ... get ... help.

Fields.MenuText: Crawl left.
Crawl right.

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Captain? Captain!!
... You sound... so far away.
You - get the Captain to the sick bay! Now!
On it, Fräulein!
... Need... me...
We'll be fine without you. Go! Get them patched up!
No time to waste, Captain. We've got witches to kill.
@BATTLE
It's good to see you up and about, Captain!
Thankfully, the drug wasn't that strong.
... Drug?
Mm. I didn't think you would stoop that low, Glorious.
What are you talking about?!
I checked the hold as soon as I could stand up. And wouldn't you know...
All the gold was gone? Every bit of it.
Captain, what are you saying?
*Someone* drugged me, and while I was unconscious, they got all the gold out of the hold. We need to figure out who.
But you don't think **I**--

Fields.MenuText: You're the prime suspect.
Where were you when the gold went missing?
I don't think you did. But until we figure out who did...

Fields.DialogueText: But surely other people had the means to steal it!
I - uh - well--
... You've got to treat me like I did it.
Take her to the brig, Private. We'll get to the bottom of this later.
Roger! I mean-- Yes, Captain!
You'll have to let me out as soon as the Morganas attack, Captain. Then what? Will you just put me in jail again?
*ALARM*
... The *brig,* Midshipman.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
So? How did it go?
Fewer casualties than we could have had.
Hah. Without my luck, you're at a disadvantage.
You have anything else incredibly obvious to tell me?
I didn't steal the gold, Captain.
If you didn't, who did?
Don't know. Working on it.
Mm-hm.
Think about it logically, Captain. I'm trying to get the gold I need to resurrect my sister.
Would I really give the Admiralty hot gold? It'd be a tacit admission of guilt.

Fields.MenuText: You don't tend to think these things through.
You have a point. That'd be foolhardy, even for you.
You really expect me to believe you?

Fields.DialogueText: Eesh, what's that supposed to mean?
I expect you to take me seriously. That's why I signed on with you, Captain.
On the contrary, Captain! I plan everything out.
... Look, I don't want to believe you'd screw us over like that.
But you have the means, the motive, and the opportunity. You're the most likely suspect.
I also have an alibi.
What? Why didn't you say so sooner?!
You were so busy throwing your weight around, I couldn't get a word in edgewise.
*ALARM*
Go talk to Midshipman Yamada. She'll set you straight.
I will. *After* we deal with these Morganas.
You gonna let me out this time?
... We'll see.
@BATTLE
So let me get this straight, Yamada.
Glorious came to you in the middle of the night...
That's right.
Wearing that goddamn diving getup.
*Hai,* Kanchou.
And she asked you to spot her while she practiced diving.
*Hai.* She wanted to make sure she was not putting herself in danger.
And so the entire time that the gold was being stolen...
Glorious was overboard. Yes.

Fields.MenuText: Did Glorious stay there the entire time?
Did you see her go anywhere near the hold?
Did you see Glorious talk to anyone? She could have had accomplices.

Fields.DialogueText: Negative, Kanchou. She was too excited about the suit.
Negative, Kanchou. She was off the prow the entire time.
Affirmative, Kanchou. She was underwater the entire time the gold was being stolen.
If you hadn't been part of the crew for years, I'd never believe you.
You do not *have* to believe me. But I know what I saw and what I did.
Thank you, Midshipman. You're dismissed.
*ALARM*
That is... a lot of Morganas.
We'll handle them. Get everyone on deck.
On it!
... And someone go get Glorious. We need all the help we can get.
@BATTLE
So, uh. It seems I owe you an apology.
Is *that* so?
You had an alibi, and as far as I can tell, it's solid. There's no reason to keep you locked up.
Glad you've seen reason, Captain.
Now that you've let me out, I've got a tip. Could help your little investigation.
Let's hear it.
When I was underwater, I saw the hold open. Someone chucked a bunch of the gold bars underwater.

Fields.MenuText: You realize that implicates you again?
Did you see who it was?
Open hold? Did we lose anything else?

Fields.DialogueText: I had Yamada double check. We're actually up a couple of torpedoes.
Nope. But I have a good idea who it might be.
Captain! Do you really think I'm that stupid?
Are you going to test that theory?
I never said you were *stupid,* exactly...
Up a couple of-- Who the hell put them there?
Hmph. I'm going to investigate on my own.
Luck's on my side, Captain. I can feel it. We'll dig up these crooks.
Says the crook.
Takes one to know one, Captain.
*ALARM*
Well. At least we know one thing for sure.
That we need to take on these Morganas?
Took the words out of my mouth, Captain!
@BATTLE
They're compatible with me, you know. It'd be more of a bother returning them than putting them to good use, right?
All right, let's leave... whoever's... gross negligence of materiel for another day.
So, handsome... you like diving?
O-oh, Miss Glorious? Yeah, I think you could say I-
I'm no expert, but, well, I've done it a few times...
Mm-*hm?*
You're, uh, you're standin' real close, Miss Glorious.
Oh, my friends call me Glory.
And we're friends here, aren't we, Lucky?
U-um...
So... why don't you tell me more about your diving? How *deep* can you go?
Glorious? What on *earth* do you think you're doing?
Captain! What an *unexpected* surprise!
"Unexpected" doesn't even begin to cover it.
I... I'm just gonna go.
Wait. You haven't been dismissed, sailor.
There's no need to give us the third degree, Captain! I was just, uh, interested in Lucky's exploits.

Fields.MenuText: "Exploits."
Your love life's none of my business, but--
You realize this makes you look guilty as sin.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain! I'm passionate about diving, didn't you realize?
No, Captain. *You* closed that door.
Whatever would give you that idea, Captain? We were having a *nice* conversation. About *diving.*
*ALARM*
Get to your stations. We'll talk about this later.
Yes, Captain.
Of course, Captain!
@BATTLE
They're onto us, man. We should cut our losses.
Are you crazy?!
Swear I'm not. The ship-broad tried to pump me--
And the Captain's tryin' to get someone to squeal.
So you don't squeal.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Some of the new blokes are missing, Captain.
We'll deal with that later. Focus on the battle!
Did I say I was gonna?
They have no way of knowin' it was us. We're gonna skip town at the next port.
You'll pay off your debts, we'll retire to Monaco and live like kings.
No way of knowing... until you laid it out for us, gentlemen!
It's the broad! Scram!
Let's see... that's grand theft, conspiracy, desertion, and if you're Her Maj's subjects, high treason.
Glorious? Where the hell did you go?! We've got more company--
They're getting away, Captain! We have to do something-
*RAT-TAT-TAT*
I'm hit!
That's what you get for getting in our way.
Head for the boats. We'll get off this tin can before they notice she's gone.
Has anyone seen Glorious?
She went down to the hold, Captain. Said something about "a lead."
We'd better find her. That second wave of Morganas looks ugly.
Glorious? Where'd you go?
Glorious!
Nn... 'm fine, Cap... jus' a scratch...
More than that. Medic!
Don' ... they're gettin' way....

Fields.MenuText: That doesn't matter. You're hurt.
We'll track them down as soon as you're safe.
Your safety comes first. Without you, our goose is cooked.

Fields.DialogueText: Real... sen'mental of ya... Cap....
Nn... Don't matter... that much...
... No time...
*ALARM*
Oh no, that's the last thing we needed.
Jus'... my luck...
@BATTLE
Do you think we lost 'em?
It doesn't matter. Keep rowing!
We're miles from land. Could you take the oars?
I'm the brains of this operation. You're the muscle.
Um...
So I gotta save my energy. *You* keep rowing.
Markus?
What?
She's - she's coming this way.
You're kidding me.
It's - kind of hard to miss - an entire aircraft carrier!
So row *faster,* dumbass.
This is HMS Glorious. Weigh anchor and surrender, or we will use force.
Now who's the dumbass?!
We can still lose 'em. See, back there? There's Morganas bearing down on 'em.
Captain, what do we do? They're making for the islands.

Fields.MenuText: Cut them off before they can get there.
Ignore them. Go after the Morganas.
They're two men in a rowboat. We wait them out and focus on the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: Got it. Turn fifteen degrees starboard--
You sure that's wise? That's a small craft. We'll lose 'em.
We might lose 'em before we shake the Morganas.
*BOOM*
Great, we're surrounded! *Just* what we needed.
We'll fight them off. Keep their fire off the boat if you can.
They tried to kill me!
Yeah, and we'll have an easier time clearing your name if we can get the gold back.
Fair enough.
We've got this, Glorious. Let's show them what you can do!
@BATTLE
It's been a good eight hours. And we hurt the dame.
I hear they heal real fast--
Ugh... Can't you row any faster?
No! No, I can't.
Hey, hey! Don't put the oars down!
*HEY! WE SURRENDER!*
What the hell do you think you're doing?!
Saving your worthless hide.
You bastard--
This was a stupid plan. I can't believe I let you talk me into it--
Hands up, gentlemen. Come quietly, and we'll let you live.
--Damn. The ugly one just jumped.
Oh, don't look at me like that, he tried to shoot me!
Did I say anything?
WE SURRENDER. WE'LL COME QUIETLY. P-Please don't shoot--
Get this idiot back aboard, and take him to the brig.
With *pleasure.*
Let's clean up the last few Morganas...
@BATTLE
And then get the second idiot?
Sometimes it's like you can read my mind.
Just a few more to go.
Good. With any luck, we'll get the Morganas *and* our thieves.
@BATTLE
Reporting, Captain. Mostly good news.
Oh? Fire away.
We sank the majority of the Morganas, and the stragglers scattered. They're not on course for any cities that we know of.
What about the thieves?
We dredged them both up. They're mad as a pair of wet hens, but they'll live.
The little one sang like a canary. We got the coordinates out of him, and we can swing back around and get the gold.
Everything worked out for the best, then.
When you're with me, it always will. I have Lady Luck wrapped around my little finger.

Fields.MenuText: Seems like she's got you wrapped around hers.
I'm just glad you healed up like you did.

Fields.DialogueText: They can't keep me down for long, Captain! It's why you'll always need me.

Fields.MenuText: Save Lady Luck's favour for when you need it.

Fields.DialogueText: Pssssh. We go back a long way, the Lady and I. I need her like you need me.
I *always* need it. And so you'll always need me.
Mmm... Don't push your luck.
It's got me where I am today, hasn't it?
Speaking of which.
Mm?
With your permission, we'll turn around and get the gold. I've practiced enough with the diving suit that I should be able to dredge it up.
And I'm sure you have no ulterior motives for this.
So maybe I want to practice before I hunt for sunken treasure. So what?
Never change, Glorious. Never change.
Is that the last of the gold?
Near enough! Whoa--
Hey, hey, careful! If you fall over, we'll have to send you back down.
Nnnngh, don't threaten me like that.
What? I thought you liked treasure hunting.
I do! But it's cold down there. And I can't *see.*
Uh-huh. And you think it won't be colder off the American coast?
I hear Florida's nice this time of year.
Mm. Maybe we'll get sent there next.
A girl can dream.
Say... Captain? Are you mad at me?
What? Why would I be mad at you?
I tried to put the moves on that skinny berk, and you, er... you blew your top.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know what I was looking at.
You scared the spit out of me.
Fraternization is wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought you could tell what I was doing--
I thought it'd be obvious, Captain--
Why on earth-- Look, all I was trying to--
Let me finish, Glory.
I didn't know what your plan was. But as soon as I thought about it for more than a few minutes, it was obvious.
... You read me that easily?
You were trying to seduce that thief to get information out of him, weren't you?
Yes, Captain. I thought that if he was the thief, I'd get everything out of him we needed to know...
And if he wasn't, then... at least I could tell you the crew was innocent.
By sleeping your way through everyone aboard?
Not *everyone*. You're not interested, and Yamada only likes men.
I *see.* Two crewmates down, eight hundred forty to go?
It wasn't like *that*, Captain!
Things have changed, Glory.
What?
You don't have to "protect" your crew from your Captain. You never will again.
I... Captain, are you *sure*?
As sure as I can be of anything these days. We *both* want what's best for everyone aboard.
I wanted to protect the crew from... well, punishments. So I needed to figure out who was behind the theft. That seemed like the easiest way.
I'm not your last Captain. I'm not going to hurt your crew. If something like this happens again, I'll do my best to be fair.
Captain, I... This is a lot to take in...
Take your time, Glory. It's all right.
*ALARM*
At least some things never change. Let's get them!
You really can't see in that suit, huh?
What? What do you mean, Captain?
The Morganas are over *there*, mate.
@BATTLE
I almost can't believe we made landfall after all that nonsense.
I can't either. But we're safe and sound.
Mmhm. And so is our cargo.
Mm. I'm going to be sad to see it go.
Well, not *all* of it...
Oh? I guess I could leave the art to hang.
No, I mean our "new crewmen." We're turning them over to the proper authorities.
Good riddance.
Do you regret it, Glorious?
Regret what? Not beating them to the punch?
Can't say I do, Captain. I wanted the gold, but I have *some* self-control.

Fields.MenuText: I'll believe that when I see it.
You don't think your luck would protect you?
Just let me know next time you're tempted.

Fields.DialogueText: So you don't believe your own eyes, Captain?
There's bad luck, and there's stupid. You can't fix stupid.
You will be the angel on my shoulder, Captain.
*ALARM*
Let's defend the dock. We can't let our valuables go to waste.
We *could* still let the art hang.
Never change, Glorious. Never change.
@BATTLE
Got any threes?
Very funny, Captain. Now, raise or fold?
Raise.
You sound sure of yourself.
I am. I figured out how you play.
Oh? And how's that?
Can't give away my secrets. Speaking of which, did you talk to Provence yet?
She just wrote me back this morning.
And what did she say?
She called me a bloody philistine, Captain.
Oh, dear.
*Just* because I don't have a favourite painting--
Keep at it. You two have more in common than you'd think.
Is that so?
You're both very....

Fields.MenuText: ... Passionate.
... Creative.
... Foul-mouthed.

Fields.DialogueText: Hm, suppose you're right.
A-bloody-men to that, Captain.
Me? Nah, I just like to solve problems.
You're quite good at it.
And you're good at poker.
What can I say? Your luck's rubbed off on me.
Matter of fact, you've gotten a lot *better* since the last time we played.
Suspiciously better.
Well...
If I remember right, last hand, you had a full house.
So?
And this hand, you also had an ace... That makes five aces, Captain.
Hah! I didn't think you'd notice.
What was all that you were saying, about not trusting a girl who plays five aces?
I think I can trust a girl who plays five aces... As long as she's Glorious.
Well, if you can trust me, then I guess I can trust you. Cards on the table, Captain?
Here's my whole hand. I have nothing to hide.
Except a sixth ace. Who taught you to play this game?
I learned from the very best.
